SENT.plain: A rare case of homozygous protein C deficiency occurred in a newborn
The patient presented with purpura fulminans in the first few hours after birth and showed multiple hemorrhagic lesions on computed tomography of the brain at 5 days of age
Neurologic symptoms developed at two weeks and the patient died at 37 weeks
His protein C level was less than 5%
Autopsy revealed thrombosis of the dural sinuses, multiple cortical infarcts, intraparenchymal hemorrhages, and hydrocephalus
The pathologic findings are correlated with the neurologic deficits and previously documented cases are reviewed
